The fall of Andrew, the black sheep of Britain's royal family
subhead: Once Queen Elizabeth II's favorite son, Prince Andrew lost his title and privileges after years of excess and proven ties to Jeffrey Epstein, the American financier accused of sexual crimes. King Charles III's decision was seen as inevitable to protect the monarchy.

subhead: 'The key targets for Russia last night were residential areas in Kyiv and energy facilities,' President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Friday, stating the attack deliberately targeted civilians.

title: Brother of Marseille anti-drugs figure murdered on street
subhead: Mehdi Kessaci, 20, was the brother of Amine Kessaci, a well-known local figure in the fight against the devastation caused by drug trafficking. He was shot and killed in broad daylight on Thursday.

title: The relentless spiral of speed watching: 'If I don't set it to at least 1.5×, I get bored'
subhead: From TikTok to YouTube, more and more young people are watching videos at increased speeds to consume more content in less time.

title: Leaders of international Gen Z movement reflect on their countries' political futures
subhead: From Nepal to Madagascar and Peru, youth-led revolts driven by socio-economic demands have shaken governments. But their horizontal mobilization strategy, born of digital culture, now hampers the political outcomes of these movements.

title: How the Paris attacks of November 13, 2015, unfolded, minute-by-minute
subhead: Le Monde has gathered exclusive first-hand testimonies and created a 3D Bataclan reconstruction to revisit the night that changed France, 10 years ago.

title: She was hanging from the Bataclan's window. He caught her hand.
subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.
